Layer.provinceImageBuffer

Function/Meaning
Province image buffer pointer
Type
Property of the Layer class (read-only)
Description
Represents a pointer to the upper-left corner of the image buffer for the province image (an 8bpp bitmap containing province information).
This property exists to provide a means of direct access to the image buffer for plugins and similar purposes.
It is returned as an integer type, but should be cast to an appropriate type (such as const unsigned char *) when used in plugins.
Do not write values to the pointer obtained with this property. You can write to the pointer if it was obtained via Layer.provinceImageBufferForWrite.
If no image is allocated, NULL (0) is returned. If no image is allocated, the entire area must be considered as province number 0.
The image size is represented by the Layer.imageWidth and Layer.imageHeight properties.
Refer to Layer.provinceImageBufferPitch for the pointer calculation method.
Reference
Layer.provinceImageBufferForWrite
Layer.provinceImageBufferPitch
